newsitem.title: USA: "Michael" leads Christas box office receipts.
newsitem.headline: "Michael" leads Christas box office receipts.

text.p: The comedy "Michael" starring John Travolta as a mischievous angel led all movies with $5.5 million in ticket sales on Christmas Day, according to industry figures released Thursday.

The movie, released by Turner Broadcasting System Inc.'s New Line Cinema on Christmas, beat out "Beavis and Butt-head Do America," the top grossing movie last weekend that came in third on Christmas Day with $2.7 million in box office sales.

The Beavis and Butt-head movie took in $20.5 million last weekend, a record for a December opening, according to Exhibitor Relations Co., which tracks box office receipts. The film was released by Paramount Pictures, a unit of Viacom Inc.

Ranking second on Christmas Day with $3.1 million in ticket sales was "Jerry Maguire," a romantic comedy starring Tom Cruise as a sports agent, released three weeks ago by the TriStar Pictures unit of Sony Corp.
The horror movie "Scream" came in fourth with $2 million in sales and "The Preacher's Wife," distributed by Walt Disney Co.'s Buena Vista, ranked fifth at $1.6 million.
"Scream," directed by Wes Craven, features Neve Campbell, Drew Barrymore and Courteney Cox. It is distributed by Disney-owned Miramax Films.
"One Fine Day," a romantic comedy starring George Clooney and Michelle Pfeiffer, took in $1.6 million.
Several other films, such as Disney's "Evita" and Sony's "The People vs. Larry Flynt," debuted on Christmas Day but were released on a limited number of screens.
"Evita," a musical starring Madonna as Argentina's Eva Peron, took in $71,308 at two theaters, one in New York and one in Los Angeles.
Columbia's "The People vs. Larry Flynt" starring Woody Harrelson as the controversial magazine publisher, grossed an estimated $48,483 on five screens.
Rounding out the top 10 films for Christmas Day were:
